Softsign¶

class layers.activation.Softsign.Softsign[source]¶

Implements the Softsign activation layer.

The Softsign function is a non-linear activation function that squashes input values into the range [-1, 1], similar to the Tanh function. Its formula is f(x) = x / (1 + |x|). It can be an alternative to Tanh but is less prone to saturation.

input¶

Stores the input from the forward pass, which is needed to calculate the gradient in the backward pass.

Type:

np.ndarray

backward(grad_output)[source]¶

Performs the backward pass of the layer.

It computes the derivative of the Softsign function and applies it to the incoming gradient from the next layer (using the chain rule).

Parameters:

grad_output (np.ndarray) – The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s output.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s input.

  • None, since Softsign has no trainable parameters.

Return type:

tuple[np.ndarray, None]

forward(input_data)[source]¶

Performs the forward pass of the layer.

Parameters:

input_data (np.ndarray) – The input data from the previous layer.

Returns:

The output of the layer after applying the Softsign function.

Return type:

np.ndarray
